div.strong: We're "Rewriting Our Story" in Marshall ISD! Get MISD Press Releases and Newsletters delivered to your inbox by signing up with our new free e-mail marketing service, Constant Contact! Click on the logo to register for free today!

div.div: News

a.title: MISD School Board Approves Architect For New Ag Barn

div.div: April 2020

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled MISD School Board Approves Architect For New Ag Barn

div.div: MISD School Board Approves Architect For New Ag Barn
Marshall ISD's Board of Trustees approved the district's recommendation to hire the firm of Brown Reynolds Watford (BRW) as architects for the new Ag Barn to be constructed at Marshall High School.
VIEW MORE About MISD School Board Approves Architect For New Ag Barn

a.title: Gov. Abbott Announces All Schools Closed For Remainder Of 2019-2020

div.div: April 2020

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Gov. Abbott Announces All Schools Closed For Remainder Of 2019-2020

div.div: Gov. Abbott Announces All Schools Closed For Remainder Of 2019-2020

Texas Governor Greg Abbott announced earlier today that all schools in Texas will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year due to ongoing efforts to stop the spread of COVID-19. Marshall ISD will continue to work with our students and families to finish out this school year via online learning.
VIEW MORE About Gov. Abbott Announces All Schools Closed For Remainder Of 2019-2020

a.title: Truelove, Palmer Named Val/Sal of MHS Class Of 2020

div.div: April 2020

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Truelove, Palmer Named Val/Sal of MHS Class Of 2020

div.div: Truelove, Palmer Named Val/Sal of MHS Class Of 2020
Cate Truelove is the Marshall High School Class of 2020 Valedictorian and Elizabeth Palmer is Salutatorian in the final senior class rankings announced Thursday morning.
VIEW MORE About Truelove, Palmer Named Val/Sal of MHS Class Of 2020
April 2020

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled STEM Testing Postponed To Summer 2020

div.div: STEM Testing Postponed To Summer 2020
Due to the current school closure through May 4 via executive order by Texas Gov. Greg Abbott, testing for the MISD STEM program for the 2020-2021 school year has been postponed until the summer.
VIEW MORE About STEM Testing Postponed To Summer 2020
March 2020

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled MISD Approves 2020-2021 Academic Calendar

div.div: MISD Approves 2020-2021 Academic Calendar
Marshall ISD's Board of Trustees approved the 2020-2021 District Academic Calendar during their regular March meeting held in the Pat Smith Gasperson Board Room Monday evening.
VIEW MORE About MISD Approves 2020-2021 Academic Calendar

a.title: MISD, Hellas Reach Agreement For Turf Replacement In Maverick Stadium

div.div: March 2020

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled MISD, Hellas Reach Agreement For Turf Replacement In Maverick Stadium

div.div: MISD, Hellas Reach Agreement For Turf Replacement In Maverick Stadium

Marshall ISD's Board of Trustees has approved a proposal from Hellas Construction, Inc., to replace the turf at Maverick Stadium at no cost to the district due to defects of the surface that was originally installed back in 2015.
VIEW MORE About MISD, Hellas Reach Agreement For Turf Replacement In Maverick Stadium

td.span:
Texas Gov. Greg Abbott has announced that all schools in Texas will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. MISD will continue to work with our students and families to finish out this school year via online learning.
For more information regarding MISD and the school closures due to COVID-19, please visit our "School Closures" web page located HERE. This page is updated with information regarding school closures and student learning opportunities, as well as links to follow for information regarding COVID-19.

span.span: The Marshall Independent School District hereby cancels the election for District 1, District 2, District 4 and District 5 scheduled to be held on Saturday, May 2, 2020, in accordance with Section 2.053(a) of the Texas Election Code.

div.span: The Marshall Independent School District proudly serves approximately 5,500 students every year as the only public school district in Marshall, Texas. MISD has seven campuses serving students in Pre-K through 12th grade. These campuses include an early childhood center, four K-5 elementary schools, a junior high for grades 6-8, and Marshall High School for students in grades 9-12. Marshall High School is the centerpiece of the district and is one of Marshall's most notable landmarks for those driving into town via U.S. Highway 59 or Texas Highway 43. MHS has consistently met state accountability standards and is a full-fledged 9-12 AVID (Advancement Via Individual Determination) campus. MISD has a designated STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) Academy at Sam Houston Elementary School, and the STEM program now serves students in grades K-8 in the district. The original goal of the district's STEM program, first implemented in 2014, is to become a full-fledged, K-12 STEM district.

Marshall ISD is located in Marshall, in Harrison County, in upper east Texas. Marshall is 40 minutes from Shreveport, La., to the east and just over two hours from the Dallas/Fort Worth metroplex to the west. Marshall is located at the intersection of three major highways -- Interstate 20, U.S. Highway 59 and Texas Highway 43. Historic Caddo Lake is located less than 20 minutes to the northeast of downtown Marshall, and the city is also just a short drive from Lake o' the Pines to the northwest. The district was founded in 1898 with the creation of Marshall High School. The opening of our Legacy 2017 schools in the fall of 2017 consolidated the district from 12 to 7 schools. Feel free to contact us with questions regarding the district at 903-927-8700.
